Boundaries with other disorders and conditions (differential diagnosis) Boundary with adjustment disorder and post-traumatic stress disorder If symptoms have not begun to diminish within about 1 week of the stressor ceasing (or within about 1 month in the case of continuing stressors), a diagnosis such as adjustment disorder or post-traumatic stress disorder should be considered, depending on the nature of the symptoms. Acute stress reaction does not typically include psychotic symptoms such as hallucinations or delusions that are characteristic of acute and transient psychotic disorder. Boundary with other mental disorders The symptoms do not meet the diagnostic requirements for another mental disorder, such as acute and transient psychotic disorder, a depressive disorder, an anxiety or fear-related disorder, or a dissociative disorder.
